result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarco Lashaun McDaniel

records.addlTxt: Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in Court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in Court for Demarco Lashaun McDaniel.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his/her rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Defense requested a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI). Court granted request. Court ordered a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI) WITHOUT Recommendation. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1: On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 1 AMENDED TO SECOND DEGREE RECKLESS INJURY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 940.23(2)(a), 939.50(3)(f), a Class F Felony.

NEW DATE: Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has received Discovery materials and Offer letter. Defense advised the court of possible resolution and is requesting date for Plea hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 06-23-22; received and filed.

Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in court by video with Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Scheduling Conference scheduled for XXX, 2022 at X. Hearing will be held via/Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 

E-FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Demarco Lashaun McDaniel in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demarco Lashaun McDaniel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
